name: CoqEAL
description: Framework to ease change of data representations in proofs.

name: FCF
description: Framework for proofs of cryptography.

name: Fiat
description: Mostly automated synthesis of correct-by-construction programs.

name: FreeSpec
description: Framework for modularly verifying programs with effects and effect handlers.

name: Hybrid
description: System for reasoning using higher-order abstract syntax representations of object logics.

name: Iris
description: Higher-order concurrent separation logic framework.

name: Q*cert
description: Platform for implementing and verifying query compilers.

name: Verdi
description: Framework for formally verifying distributed systems implementations.

name: VST
description: Toolchain for verifying C code inside Coq in a higher-order concurrent, impredicative separation logic that is sound w.r.t. the Clight language of the CompCert compiler.

name: CoqIDE
description: Standalone graphical tool for interacting with Coq.

name: Coqtail
description: Interface for Coq based on the Vim text editor.

name: Proof General
description: Generic interface for proof assistants based on the extensible, customizable text editor Emacs.

name: Company-Coq
description: IDE extensions for Proof General's Coq mode.

name: jsCoq
description: Port of Coq to JavaScript, which enables running Coq projects in a browser.

name: Jupyter kernel for Coq
description: Coq support for the Jupyter Notebook web environment.

name: VSCoq
description: Extension for the Visual Studio Code editor.

name: ALEA
description: Library for reasoning on randomized algorithms.

name: Algebra Tactics
description: Ring and field tactics for Mathematical Components.

name: Bignums
description: Library of arbitrarily large numbers.

name: Bedrock Bit Vectors
description: Library for reasoning on fixed precision machine words.

name: CertiGraph
description: Library for reasoning about directed graphs and their embedding in separation logic.

name: CoLoR
description: Library on rewriting theory, lambda-calculus and termination, with sub-libraries on common data structures extending the Coq standard library.

name: coq-haskell
description: Library smoothing the transition to Coq for Haskell users.

name: CoqInterval
description: Tactics for performing proofs of inequalities on expressions of real numbers.

name: Coq record update
description: Library which provides a generic way to update Coq record fields.

name: Coq-std++
description: Extended alternative standard library for Coq.

name: ExtLib
description: Collection of theories and plugins that may be useful in other Coq developments.

name: FCSL-PCM
description: Formalization of partial commutative monoids as used in verification of pointer-manipulating programs.

name: Flocq
description: Formalization of floating-point numbers and computations.

name: Formalised Undecidable Problems
description: Library of undecidable problems and reductions between them.

name: Hahn
description: Library for reasoning on lists and binary relations.

name: Interaction Trees
description: Library for representing recursive and impure programs.

name: MathComp Extra
description: Extra material for the Mathematical Components library, including the AKS primality test and RSA encryption and decryption.

name: Mczify
description: Library enabling Micromega arithmetic solvers to work when using Mathematical Components number definitions.

name: Metalib
description: Library for programming language metatheory using locally nameless variable binding representations.

name: Paco
description: Library for parameterized coinduction.

name: Regular Language Representations
description: Translations between different definitions of regular languages, including regular expressions and automata.

name: Relation Algebra
description: Modular formalization of algebras with heterogeneous binary relations as models.

name: Simple IO
description: Input/output monad with user-definable primitive operations.

name: TLC
description: Non-constructive alternative to Coq's standard library.

name: coq_makefile
description: Build tool distributed with Coq and based on generating a makefile.

name: Coq Nix Toolbox
description: Nix helper scripts to automate local builds and continuous integration for Coq.

name: Coq Package Index
description: Collection of Coq packages based on opam.

name: Coq Platform
description: Curated collection of packages to support Coq use in industry, education, and research.

name: coq-community Templates
description: Templates for generating configuration files for Coq projects.

name: Docker-Coq
description: Docker images for many versions of Coq.

name: Docker-MathComp
description: Docker images for many combinations of versions of Coq and the Mathematical Components library.

name: Docker-Coq GitHub Action
description: GitHub container action that can be used with Docker-Coq or Docker-MathComp.

name: Dune
description: Composable and opinionated build system for OCaml and Coq (former jbuilder).

name: Nix
description: Package manager for Linux and other Unix systems, supporting atomic upgrades and rollbacks.

name: Nix Coq packages
description: Collection of Coq-related packages for Nix.

name: opam
description: Flexible and Git-friendly package manager for OCaml and Coq with multiple compiler support.

name: AAC Tactics
description: Tactics for rewriting universally quantified equations, modulo associativity and commutativity of some operator.

name: Coq-Elpi
description: Extension framework based on Î»Prolog providing an extensive API to implement commands and tactics.

name: CoqHammer
description: General-purpose automated reasoning hammer tool that combines learning from previous proofs with the translation of problems to automated provers and the reconstruction of found proofs.

name: Equations
description: Function definition package for Coq.

name: Gappa
description: Tactic for discharging goals about floating-point arithmetic and round-off errors.

name: Hierarchy Builder
description: Collection of commands for declaring Coq hierarchies based on packed classes.

name: Ltac2
description: Experimental typed tactic language similar to Coq's classic Ltac language.

name: MetaCoq
description: Project formalizing Coq in Coq and providing tools for manipulating Coq terms and developing certified plugins.

name: Mtac2
description: Plugin adding typed tactics for backward reasoning.

name: Paramcoq
description: Plugin to generate parametricity translations of Coq terms.

name: QuickChick
description: Plugin for randomized property-based testing.

name: SMTCoq
description: Tool that checks proof witnesses coming from external SAT and SMT solvers.

name: Unicoq
description: Plugin that replaces the existing unification algorithm with an enhanced one.

name: Alectryon
description: Collection of tools for writing technical documents that mix Coq code and prose.

name: Autosubst 2
description: Tool that generates Coq code for handling binders in syntax, such as for renaming and substitutions.

name: CFML
description: Tool for proving properties of OCaml programs in separation logic.

name: coq2html
description: Alternative HTML documentation generator for Coq.

name: coqdoc
description: Standard documentation tool that generates LaTeX or HTML files from Coq code.

name: CoqOfOCaml
description: Tool for generating idiomatic Coq from OCaml code.

name: coq-dpdgraph
description: Tool for building dependency graphs between Coq objects.

name: coq-scripts
description: Scripts for dealing with Coq files, including tabulating proof times.

name: coq-tools
description: Scripts for manipulating Coq developments.

name: find-bug.py
description: Automatically minimizes source files producing an error, creating small test cases for Coq bugs.

name: absolutize-imports.py
description: Processes source files to make loading of dependencies robust against shadowing of file names.

name: inline-imports.py
description: Creates stand-alone source files from developments by inlining the loading of all dependencies.

name: minimize-requires.py
description: Removes loading of unused dependencies.

name: move-requires.py
description: Moves all dependency loading statements to the top of source files.

name: move-vernaculars.py
description: Lifts many vernacular commands and inner lemmas out of proof script blocks.

name: proof-using-helper.py
description: Modifies source files to include proof annotations for faster parallel proving.

name: Cosette
description: Automated solver for reasoning about SQL query equivalences.

name: hs-to-coq
description: Converter from Haskell code to equivalent Coq code.

name: lngen
description: Tool for generating locally nameless Coq definitions and proofs.

name: Menhir
description: Parser generator that can output Coq code for verified parsers.

name: mCoq
description: Mutation analysis tool for Coq projects.

name: Ott
description: Tool for writing definitions of programming languages and calculi that can be translated to Coq.

name: Roosterize
description: Tool for suggesting lemma names in Coq projects.

name: Sail
description: Tool for specifying instruction set architecture semantics of processors and generating Coq definitions.

name: SerAPI
description: Tools and OCaml library for (de)serialization of Coq code to and from JSON and S-expressions.

name: Analysis
description: Library for classical real analysis compatible with Mathematical Components.

name: Category Theory in Coq
description: Axiom-free formalization of category theory.

name: Completeness and Decidability of Modal Logic Calculi
description: Soundness, completeness, and decidability for the logics K, K*, CTL, and PDL.

name: CoqPrime
description: Library for certifying primality using Pocklington and Elliptic Curve certificates.

name: CoRN
description: Library of constructive real analysis and algebra.

name: Coqtail Math
description: Library of mathematical results ranging from arithmetic to real and complex analysis.

name: Coquelicot
description: Formalization of classical real analysis compatible with the standard library and focusing on usability.

name: Finmap
description: Extension of Mathematical Components with finite maps, sets, and multisets.

name: Four Color Theorem
description: Formal proof of the Four Color Theorem, a landmark result of graph theory.

name: Gaia
description: Implementation of books from Bourbaki's Elements of Mathematics, including set theory and number theory.

name: GeoCoq
description: Formalization of geometry based on Tarski's axiom system.

name: Goedel
description: Constructive proof of the GÃ¶del-Rosser incompleteness theorem.

name: Graph Theory
description: Formalized graph theory results.

name: Homotopy Type Theory
description: Development of homotopy-theoretic ideas.

name: Infotheo
description: Formalization of information theory and linear error-correcting codes.

name: Mathematical Components
description: Formalization of mathematical theories, focusing in particular on group theory.

name: Math Classes
description: Abstract interfaces for mathematical structures based on type classes.

name: Monae
description: Monadic effects and equational reasoning.

name: Odd Order Theorem
description: Formal proof of the Odd Order Theorem, a landmark result of finite group theory.

name: Puiseuxth
description: Proof of Puiseux's theorem and computation of roots of polynomials of Puiseux's series.

name: UniMath
description: Library which aims to formalize a substantial body of mathematics using the univalent point of view.

name: CompCert
description: High-assurance compiler for almost all of the C language (ISO C99), generating efficient code for the PowerPC, ARM, RISC-V and x86 processors.

name: Ceramist
description: Verified hash-based approximate membership structures such as Bloom filters.

name: Fiat-Crypto
description: Cryptographic primitive code generation.

name: Incremental Cycles
description: Verified OCaml implementation of an algorithm for incremental cycle detection in graphs.

name: Jasmin
description: Formalized language and verified compiler for high-assurance and high-speed cryptography.

name: JSCert
description: Coq specification of ECMAScript 5 (JavaScript) with verified reference interpreter.

name: lambda-rust
description: Formal model of a Rust core language and type system, a logical relation for the type system, and safety proofs for some Rust libraries.

name: Prosa
description: Definitions and proofs for real-time system schedulability analysis.

name: RISC-V Specification in Coq
description: Definition of the RISC-V processor instruction set architecture and extensions.

name: Tarjan and Kosaraju
description: Verified implementations of algorithms for topological sorting and finding strongly connected components in finite graphs.

name: VÃ©lus
description: Verified compiler for a Lustre/Scade-like dataflow synchronous language.

name: Verdi Raft
description: Implementation of the Raft distributed consensus protocol, verified in Coq using the Verdi framework.

name: Coq tag on Theoretical Computer Science Stack Exchange
Coq Exchange: ideas and experiment reports about Coq
Joachim Breitner's blog posts on Coq
MIT PLV blog posts on Coq
Poleiro: a Coq blog by Arthur Azevedo de Amorim
Ralf Jung's blog posts on Coq
Thomas Letan's blog posts on Coq
Coq'Art
description: The first book dedicated to Coq.

name: Software Foundations
description: Series of Coq-based textbooks on logic, functional programming, and foundations of programming languages, aimed at being accessible to beginners.

name: Certified Programming with Dependent Types
description: Textbook about practical engineering with Coq which teaches advanced practical tricks and a very specific style of proof.

name: Program Logics for Certified Compilers
description: Book that explains how to construct program logics using separation logic, accompanied by a formal model in Coq which is applied to the Clight programming language and other examples.

name: Formal Reasoning About Programs
description: Book that simultaneously provides a general introduction to formal logical reasoning about the correctness of programs and to using Coq for this purpose.

name: Programs and Proofs
description: Book that gives a brief and practically-oriented introduction to interactive proofs in Coq which emphasizes the computational nature of inductive reasoning about decidable propositions via a small set of primitives from the SSReflect proof language.

name: Computer Arithmetic and Formal Proofs
description: Book that describes how to formally specify and verify floating-point algorithms in Coq using the Flocq library.

name: The Mathematical Components book
description: Book oriented towards mathematically inclined users, focusing on the Mathematical Components library and the SSReflect proof language.

name: Modeling and Proving in Computational Type Theory
description: Book covering topics in computational logic using Coq, including foundations, canonical case studies, and practical programming.

name: Hydras & Co.
description: Continuously in-progress book on Kirby and Paris' hydra battles and other entertaining formalized mathematics in Coq, including library code and exercises.

name: Foundations of Separation Logic
description: Introduction to using separation logic to reason about sequential imperative programs in Coq.

name: Floating-Point Numbers and Formal Proof
description: Introductory course on Coq real numbers and floating-point numbers from the Flocq library.

name: Introduction to Computational Logic
description: Introduction to principles of logic, constructive type theory, and interactive theorem proving with Coq.

name: Proofs and Reliable Programming using Coq
description: Introduction to developing and verifying programs with Coq.

name: CodeWars' Coq kata
description: Online proving challenges.

name: Coq'Art Exercises and Tutorials
description: Coq code and exercises from the Coq'Art book, including additional tutorials.

name: Coq in a Hurry
description: Introduction to how Coq can be used to define logical concepts and functions and reason about them.

name: Coq requirements in Common Criteria evaluations
description: Guide on how to write readable and reviewable Coq code in high assurance applications.

name: Lemma Overloading
description: Demonstration of design patterns for programming and proving with canonical structures.

name: MathComp Tutorial Materials
description: Source code for Mathematical Components tutorials.

name: Mike Nahas's Coq Tutorial
description: Basics of using Coq to write formal proofs.

name: Tricks in Coq
description: Tips, tricks, and features that are hard to discover.
